P2978: wheel/axle arrangement for locomotives, railcars and other rolling stock
P1464: category item that groups people born in this place
P2293: general link between a disease and the causal genetic entity, if the detailed mechanism is unknown/unavailable
P2291: chart where the element reached a position
P264: brand and trademark associated with the marketing of subject music recordings and music videos
P1923: Like 'Participant' (P710) but for teams. For an event like a cycle race or a football match you can use this property to list the teams and P710 to list the individuals (with 'member of sports team' (P54) as a qualifier for the individuals)
P108: person or organization for which the subject works or worked
P263: the residence at which heads of government and other senior figures officially reside
P106: occupation of a person; see also "field of work" (Property:P101), "position held" (Property:P39)
P101: specialization of a person or organization; see P106 for the occupation
P103: language or languages a person has learned from early childhood
P102: the political party of which this politician is or has been a member
P2568: document is repealed/inactived by specified other document
P2560: graphics processing unit within a system
P2563: superhuman, supernatural, or paranormal abilities that the fictional subject exhibits
P2564: indicates the characteristic climate of a place
P2567: document is amended by specified other document
P1039: qualifier of "relative (P1038)" to indicate unusual family relationships (ancestor, son-in-law, adoptions, etc). Avoid using for relationships that can be derived from the family tree or have an explicit property (spouse, child, etc)
P2743: this zoological name is coordinate with
P2746: amount of a certain good produced in/by the item
P1568: set of "input" or argument values for which a mathematical function is defined
P1032: technologies  to control the use of digital content and devices after sale
P1037: person who manages any kind of group
P828: underlying cause, thing that ultimately resulted in this effect
P1034: species, genus or family that an organism depends on for nutrition
P3602: election where the subject is a candidate
P1445: to link a fictional universe with a work that describes it: <universe> "described in the work:" <work>
P3912: physical size of a newspaper (berliner, broadsheet, tabloid, etc.)
P78: Internet domain name system top-level code
P2738: every instance of this class is an instance of exactly one class in that list of classes
P463: organization or club to which the subject belongs. Do not use for membership in ethnic or social groups, nor for holding a position such as a member of parliament (use P39 for that).
P4099: typeface metrically compatible with this typeface: glyph position, width and height match
P3919: person is cited as contributing to some creative or published work or series (qualify with "subject has role", P2868)
P3985: programming language which is supported by this programming tool
P414: exchange on which this company is traded
P837: day in year for periodic occurrence
when a specific holiday or periodic event occurs. Can be used as property or qualifier
P39: subject currently or formerly holds the object position or public office
P1640: content specialist responsible for this collection or exhibition
P1560: given name version for other gender
equivalent name (with respect to the meaning of the name) in the same language: female version of a male first name, male version of a female first name. Add primarily the closest matching one
P30: continent of which the subject is a part
P31: that class of which this subject is a particular example and member (subject typically an individual member with a proper name label); different from P279; using this property as a qualifier is deprecated—use P2868 or P3831 instead
P4647: location where a work was first debuted, performed or broadcasted
P37: language designated as official by this item
P35: official with the highest formal authority in a country/state
P400: platform for which a work was developed or released, or the specific platform version of a software product
P1456: link to the list of heritage monuments in the place/area
P404: a video game's available playing mode(s)
P406: music release that incorporates music directly recorded from the soundtrack of an audiovisual work
P407: language associated with this creative work (such as books, shows, songs, or websites) or a name (for persons use P103 and P1412)
P817: type of decay that a radioactive isotope undergoes (should be used as a qualifier for "decays to")
P816: what isotope does this radioactive isotope decay to
P814: protected areas category by the World Commission on Protected Areas. Used with dedicated items for each category.
P366: main use of the subject (includes current and former usage)
P568: stratigraphic unit that this unit lies over (i.e. the underlying unit)
P567: stratigraphic unit that this unit lies under (i.e. the overlying unit)
P566: the legitimate, previously published name on which a new combination or name at new rank is based
P2922: month of the year during which this item occurs, applies to or is valid in
P2739: style of type used in a work
P562: central bank or other issuing authority for the currency
P2632: place where this person is or was detained
P2633: item that deals with the geography of the subject. Sample: "Rio de Janeiro" uses this property with value "geography of Rio de Janeiro" (Q10288853). For the location of a subject,use "location" (P276)
P3730: higher rank or level in a ranked hierarchy like sport league, military ranks. If there are several possible, list each one and qualify with "criterion used" (P1013), avoid using ranks and date qualifiers. For sports leagues/taxa, use specific properties instead.
P1420: (incorrect) name(s) listed as synonym(s) of a taxon name
P87: author of the libretto (words) of an opera, operetta, oratorio or cantata, or of the book of a musical
P1589: point with lowest elevation in the country, region, city or area
P1425: ecoregion of the item (choose from WWF's list)
P1427: starting place of this journey, flight, voyage, trek, migration etc.
P1851: a superset of the domain of a function or relation that may include some inputs for which the function is not defined; to specify the set of only those inputs for which the function is defined use domain (P1568)
P1582: links a natural product with its source (animal, plant, fungal, algal, etc.)
P4147: species formed by accepting a proton (H⁺)
P1855: example where this Wikidata property is used; target item is one that would use this property, with qualifier the property being described given the associated value
P1924: disease that a vaccine is for

P1211: fuel system that an engine uses
P708: administrative division of the church to which the element belongs; use P5607 for other types of ecclesiastical territorial entities

P703: the taxon in which the item can be found
P702: the gene that encodes some gene product

P706: located on the specified landform. Should not be used when the value is only political/administrative (P131) or a mountain range (P4552).

P2959: this item duplicates another item and the two can't be merged, as one Wikimedia project includes two pages, e. g. in different scripts or languages (applies to some wiki, e.g.: cdowiki, gomwiki). Use "duplicate item" for other wikis.

P3780: is part of and forms biologically active component. Inverse of "has active ingredient"

P159: specific location where an organization's headquarters is or has been situated. Inverse property of "occupant" (P466).

P684: orthologous gene in another species (use with 'species' qualifier)

P2079: method, process or technique used to grow, cook, weave, build, assemble, manufacture the item
P200: major inflow sources — rivers, aquifers, glacial runoff, etc. Some terms may not be place names, e.g. none
P2175: disease that this pharmaceutical drug, procedure, or therapy is used to treat
P1677: primary case, patient zero: initial patient in the population of an epidemiological investigation
P201: rivers and other outflows waterway names. If evaporation or seepage are notable outflows, they may be included. Some terms may not be place names, e.g. evaporation

P3815: institution that monitors this volcanic landform or phenomenon
P112: founder or co-founder of this organization, religion or place

P136: creative work's genre or an artist's field of work (P101). Use main subject (P921) to relate creative works to their topic
P137: person, profession, or organization that operates the equipment, facility, or service; use country for diplomatic missions

the item is located on the territory of the following administrative entity. Use P276 (location) for specifying the location of non-administrative places and for items about events

P793: significant or notable events associated with the subject

P1308: persons who hold and/or held an office or noble title

P825: person or organization to whom the subject was dedicated

P1598: bishop who presided as consecrator or co-consecrator of this bishop
P361: object of which the subject is a part (it's not useful to link objects which are themselves parts of other objects already listed as parts of the subject). Inverse property of "has part" (P527, see also "has parts of the class" (P2670)).

P1028: person or organization who donated the object
P1029: person that participated operating or serving aboard this vehicle
P3093: person, organisation or vehicle that recovered the item. Use the most specific value known.
P1366: other person or item which continues the item by replacing it in its role. Use P156 (followed by) if the item is not replaced (e.g. books in a series), nor identical, but adds to the series without dropping the role of this item in that series
P1365: person or item replaced. Use P1398 (structure replaces) for structures. Use P155 (follows) if the previous item was not replaced or if predecessor and successor are identical
